intro: Echinops leiopolyceroides, commonly known as the desert globemallow, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its spiny, spherical seed heads that resemble those of the echinops genus, though it belongs to the Malvaceae family. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in sandy or rocky soils, making it well adapted to harsh desert environments. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it a notable species in xerophytic plant communities.
